intro: Astragalus multicaulis var. viridis, commonly known as the green-stem milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, green stems that are often branched and covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, with pairs of oval leaflets that are often hairy and slightly serrated. This species is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
